ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Depression is one of the most common forms of mental disorder
There is usually no need to seek treatment for depression. People who are clinically depressed can often wait a short while and the symptoms will disappear
People who seek treatment for depression are weak and lazy
People who talk about suicide are just trying to bring attention to themselves
It is easy to predict who will get depressed and when that person will have their next depressive episode
All people who hear voices and see things no one else does have schizophrenia
There is no treatment for people who are always down in the dumps and feeling hopeless and/or low in energy
Without treatment, clinical depression rarely lasts more than one month
Over half of all children and teenagers who experience a major depressive disorder can expect to experience another episode within 5 years
In early stages of mania, someone might seem extra sociable, self-confident, creative, and feeling good
Manic depression is another name for bipolar disorder
Partial responses to prescribed medication are common
The nice thing about taking mood stabilizing medicine is that as soon as the symptoms go away, you can stop the medicine
Mood stabilizing medications are addictive
If you do not like a mood stabilizing medication, you should just stop taking it ''cold turkey'' to get it out of your system
If a mood stabilizing medication is going to work, you will know it within 1-2 days
If you forget to take a dose of your mood stabilizing medication, you should immediately take the dosage whenever you remember, no matter how long it has been.
If your body has adjusted to your mood stabilizing medication after 1-2 weeks, drinking alcohol, using other drugs, or smoking cigarettes should not affect how your medication works
Side effects are side effects - there is not much you can do to make them feel better.
Family problems are separate from depression, and so those problems should not affect depression in a family member
Fill in which of the following you know can be a symptom of a major depressive episode: Sad, anxious, irritable, and/or angry mood
Fill in which of the following you know can be a symptom of a major depressive episode: Complaints of boredom
Fill in which of the following you know can be a symptom of a major depressive episode: Previously fun activities are not fun anymore
Fill in which of the following you know can be a symptom of a major depressive episode: Sleeping too much or too little
Fill in which of the following you know can be a symptom of a major depressive episode: Eating too much or too little
Fill in which of the following you know can be a symptom of a major depressive episode: Difficulty with concentrating or making decisions
Fill in which of the following you know can be a symptom of a major depressive episode: Tired/fatigued/no energy
Fill in which of the following you know can be a symptom of a major depressive episode: Restlessness
Fill in which of the following you know can be a symptom of a major depressive episode: Feelings of worthlessness and/or guilt
Fill in which of the following you know can be a symptom of a major depressive episode: Preoccupation with death-related issues
Fill in which of the following you know can be a symptom of a major depressive episode: Thoughts about suicide
Fill in which of the following you know can be a symptom of mania: A ''high'' mood for not good reason
Fill in which of the following you know can be a symptom of mania: Too self-confident
Fill in which of the following you know can be a symptom of mania: Sleeping less
Fill in which of the following you know can be a symptom of mania: Too much talking/talking too fast
Fill in which of the following you know can be a symptom of mania: Thoughts racing through your heat (too) quickly
Fill in which of the following you know can be a symptom of mania: Very difficult time concentrating
Fill in which of the following you know can be a symptom of mania: Doing many more things than usual
Fill in which of the following you know can be a symptom of mania: Doing reckless and/or foolish things
Depression is one of the most common forms of mental disorder (Disagree/Agree)
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree
